long_desc.thetext:
From https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=437444#c48
CaptureBinding: Own version of substituteInferenceVariable() no longer handles superclass & superInterfaces (nor lowerBound, which we didn't handle before, either). Question: can we assert that the fresh CaptureBinding created here gets initializeBounds called when needed? Could we end up working with an insufficiently initialized CaptureBinding downstream? => @Srikanth, please comment.
This needs follow up.

This will be subsumed by bug 448793 which will comprehensively deal with all aspect of capture bound incorporation. I don't see a value in a loose leaf level task.
The own method CaptureBinding.substituteInferenceVariable will likely completely go away as we pull back on the work around put in place for https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8054721
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 448793 ***

Bug 448793 itself is proving to be more involved than estimated.
So nibbling at leaf tasks, I released a fix for the present bug here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=644c4d9043a8634631a6c37637807f9484dbb1d4.
No test exercises this code at the moment.
Verified for 4.5 M4 by code inspection
